page.title: Inspiration
page.content:
Here's a selection of things that inspire me categorized by broad topics.

Note: I don't read too many books, mainly because my attention span is quite short when reading. Over time I've still accumulated a few favorites. You can check out everything I'm reading at Goodreads.

Business

Startups

  • Blitzscaling by Reid Hoffman
  • why new technology is a hard sell
  • How Super Angel Chris Sacca Made Billions, Burned Bridges And Crafted The Best Seed Portfolio Ever
  • Decisions, decisions, or Why Baskets of Options Dominate by Kent Beck

Hard work

  • 10 things that require zero talent
  • Bill Gates on making "one of the greatest mistakes of all time

Misc

  • Peopleware by Tom DeMarco
  • Shoe Dog by Phil Knight
  • How to Become the Best in the World at Something
  • The ten commandments of startup success by Tim Ferriss on Masters of Scale
  • Drew Houston on The Tim Ferriss Show
  • Brian Chesky on Masters of Scale

Life

Essentialism

  • Essentialism by Greg McKeown
  • It's later than you think
  • How to say no and How to say no gracefully and uncommit on the Tim Ferriss Show

Mindset and Communication

  • Nonviolent Communication by Marshall Rosenberg
  • How to think like a Roman Emperor by Donald Robertson
  • How to Disagree by Paul Graham
  • How to succeed in high-stress situations and Stoicism 101 by Tim Ferriss

Communication

  • getting answers
  • dumber phone

Tech

  • The Pragmatic Programmer by Andy Hunt
  • Refactoring by Martin Fowler
  • Design Patterns by Gamma et al

  • Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture by Martin Fowler
  • Your Makefiles are wrong
  • Path, File, Filename
